key_points: Tennessee Governor Bill Lee announced all Tennessee adults will be eligible for COVID-19 vaccination by April 5.
Tennesseans aged 55 and older along with those in Phase 2 of the vaccination plan are eligible as of March 18.
Eligibility extends to all Tennesseans age 16 and over by April 5.
Phase 3 of the vaccination plan includes congregate living staff and residents, and grocery store workers not previously eligible.
Direct allocations of vaccines will be made to facilities housing those eligible in Phase 3.
Tennessee has received 2.9 million COVID-19 vaccine doses to date.
The state expects around 311,000 vaccine doses the week of March 22.
Increased supplies of the Johnson and Johnson vaccine are expected the week of March 29.
Health Commissioner Lisa Piercey highlights the expansion is ahead of the federal goal of May 1 for adult eligibility.
Phase 2 includes essential workers in several key industries not covered in earlier phases.
spokespersons: Lisa Piercey, MD, MBA, FAAP (Tennessee Health Commissioner)
